channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Government spending could be separated from GDP reports—doing so could distort a fundamental measure of the U.S. economy’s health
item.description: Government spending is traditionally included in the GDP because changes in taxes, spending, deficits and regulations by the government can impact the...

item.title: Unilever’s CEO shakeup signals a return to the ‘move fast’ era
item.description: Hein Schumacher's tenure as Unilever's CEO ended in less than two years because the board wanted a more rapid pace of transformation.

item.title: European Leaders Look for Allies to Secure Ukraine-Russia Peace Deal
item.description: European leaders met in London to formulate a plan to help end the war in Ukraine. But even potential peacekeepers face political and economic hurdles...

item.title: Shares in Mixue—a Chinese ice cream chain with more stores than McDonald’s—jump over 40% after Hong Kong’s largest IPO so far this year
item.description: Mixue raised $444 million in its IPO, a blockbuster listing that helps signal a turnaround in Hong Kong's IPO market.

item.title: Clock Ticks Down Toward Sweeping Tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China
item.description: President Trump could still choose to pause the tariffs he is threatening to put on America’s largest trading partners Tuesday, but industries are pre...

item.title: The Scramble After a White House Showdown, and R.F.K. Jr.’s Measles Response
item.description: Plus, “Anora” has a big night at the Oscars.

item.title: Released From Hamas Captivity, a Hostage Finds His Family Gone
item.description: Eli Sharabi gave himself up on Oct. 7, 2023, hoping to save his wife and daughters. After some 500 days in the tunnels of Gaza, he emerged to learn th...

item.title: Elon Musk labels Geoffrey Hinton ‘carelessly ignorant, cruel’ after ‘godfather of AI’ calls for him to be banished from Royal Society
item.description: Geoffrey Hinton wants Musk to be banished form the Royal Society, but note for alleged "Nazi salutes".

item.title: What Ukrainian CEOs are saying
item.description: Also: Wojcicki wants back in, Atlanta Fed predicts GDP contraction.

item.title: European Leaders Look for Allies to Secure Ukraine-Russia Peace Deal
item.description: European leaders met in London to formulate a plan to help end the war in Ukraine. But even potential peacekeepers face political and economic hurdles...

item.title: Trump Turns Up Trade Pressure on China After Beijing Fails to Come Running
item.description: China is still cautiously trying to figure out what Trump wants. The president has threatened big tariffs in response to the inaction.

item.title: How Trump’s Canada Tariffs Could Impact Both the U.S. and Canada
item.description: President Trump’s plan to apply 25 percent tariffs on Canadian exports is set to start on Tuesday. They would deal a brutal blow to Canada’s economy.

item.title: Trump Turns Up Trade Pressure on China After Beijing Fails to Come Running
item.description: China is still cautiously trying to figure out what Trump wants. The president has threatened big tariffs in response to the inaction.

item.title: Drones Now Rule the Battlefield in the Ukraine-Russia War
item.description: Drones have changed the war in Ukraine, with soldiers adapting off-the-shelf models and swarming the front lines.

item.title: Oscars 2025’s Best and Worst Moments: Speeches, Performances and More
